name: March & April 2021 pharmaceutical M&A round-up
introduction: Some of biopharma's biggest companies announced acquisitions in March and April.
content:
Some of biopharma's biggest companies announced acquisitions in March and April.

As well as the likes of Pfizer (NYSE: PFE) and Amgen (Nasdaq: AMGN), smaller drugmakers and other players in the drug development ecosystem bought companies.

Our table below provides the details:

Company Takeover candidate Value Why?
Kartesia ADL Biopharma 12 million-euros ($14.6 million) for remaining stake To help ADL become the preferred development and production partner for companies in growing end-markets such as alternative bio-based food, cosmetics and healthcare products
Amgen Five Prime Therapeutics $1.9 billion To strengthen Amgen's oncology portfolio with a promising late-stage, first-in-class global asset to treat gastric cancer (bemarituzumab)
Takeda Maverick Therapeutics Exercising of an option to acquire Maverick for a pre-negotiated upfront payment, previously reported as $125 million, as well as potential development and regulatory milestones totaling up to $525 million To add Maverick's COBRA platform to Takeda's oncology portfolio, providing a new conditional bioengineering approach to advance redirected immunotherapies against solid tumors
Grifols GigaGen Remaining 56% share capital for $80 million To further strengthen Grifols' innovation strategy
Amgen Rodeo $55 million upfront plus milestones potentially worth up to an additional $666 million Rodeo's 15-PGDH program is seen as a strong strategic fit with Amgen's inflammation portfolio
Piramal Hemmo Pharmaceuticals 7.75 billion rupees ($105.6 million) and earn-outs linked to achievement of milestones To mark PPS’ foray into the development and manufacturing of peptide active pharmaceutical ingredients, a capability that complements PPS’ existing service offering
Sterling Pharma Solutions ADC Biotechnology  Undisclosed To jointly establish a center of excellence for bioconjugation and ADC development and manufacturing services
Sanofi Tidal Therapeutics $160 million upfront and up to $310 million on the achievement of certain milestones To expand Sanofi’s research capabilities in both immuno-oncology and inflammatory diseases, while likely having broad applicability to other disease areas as well
Tango Therapeutics Boxer Capital Reverse merger To provide Tango with the capital needed to further develop its pipeline
SparingVision GAMUT Therapeutics Undisclosed To advance therapies in retinitis pigmentosa and other retinal diseases
Pfizer Amplyx Pharmaceuticals Undisclosed To strengthen Pfizer's pipeline in new anti-infective therapies to treat both emerging and difficult to treat bacterial, viral and fungal infections
